p: Samples of the traditionally cultivated (Wenzhou) C. wenyujin (WZ) were purchased from Taoshan Town, Ruian, Wenzhou, Zhejiang Province, on December 5, 2017, whereas those of the introduced (Haikou) C. wenyujin (HK) were obtained on the same date from cultivation fields at the Haikou branch of the Institute of Medicinal Plants. The cultivation management of C. wenyujin in the two areas is similar, and details of the environmental and weather conditions of these areas are presented in S1 Table. The Curcuma samples were subsequently identified as C. wenyujin Y.H. Chen & C. Ling. by Li-Rongtao, Associate Professor at the Institute of Medicinal Plants, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences. For the purposes of the present study, we selected the rhizomes of the C. wenyujin plants as the experimental materials.
